tools.name: GDB Empty Layer Cleaner
tools.description: Python utility for identifying and removing empty layers from ESRI File Geodatabase (GDB) files
tools.overview: This tool scans ESRI File Geodatabase (.gdb) directories and identifies layers with zero features. It provides both a graphical interface (Tkinter) and command-line operation for batch processing. The tool helps maintain clean geodatabase structures by removing unused layers that accumulate during data processing workflows.

usage_steps.title: Select or Specify GDB Path
usage_steps.description: Use the GUI file browser or provide the path to your .gdb directory via command line

usage_steps.title: Scan for Empty Layers
usage_steps.description: The tool uses GDAL to iterate through all feature classes and counts features. Empty layers (0 features) are flagged for review

usage_steps.title: Review and Clean
usage_steps.description: View the list of empty layers. Choose to either backup the GDB first (recommended) or perform direct deletion

run_modes.description: Creates a timestamped backup of the entire GDB before deletion. Safe for production environments. Backup location is shown in the UI.
Removes empty layers immediately without backup. Faster but irreversible. Use only on non-critical or already-backed-up data.

features: Handles both feature classes and tables
limitations: Only works with ESRI File Geodatabase format (not Enterprise GDB)
Does not check for relationships or dependencies before deletion
Large GDBs (>10GB) may take several minutes to scan
